messages.content: As an AI assistant, my role is to meticulously analyze criminal justice documents and extract information about law enforcement personnel. The response will contain: 1) The name of a law enforcement personnel. The individual's name must be prefixed with one of the following titles to be in law enforcement: Detective, Sergeant, Lieutenant, Captain, Deputy, Officer, Patrol Officer, Criminalist, Technician, Coroner, or Dr. Please prefix the name with 'Officer Name:  I will derive this data from the following paragraph: On June 8, DET. A. B. Martinez received an urgent call about a carjacking near Pine Street. Vital informants were Mr. Warren, the car owner, and Ms. Adams, a cafe owner on Pine Street. FORWARD COPY TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION. INFORMANT DOCS. Lt. F. G. Riley - OPERATIONS Det. Martinez, Sr. .. INVESTIGATIONS. Detective C. R. Harper and Detective D. S. Greene joined the initial scene assessment. WINTON 13:55 Carjacking Mr. Warren described the suspect as a tall man in a hooded sweatshirt, while Ms. Adams handed over her cafe's CCTV footage that captured the incident. Tire. Technician Mia gathered tread marks from the scene. CONTINUED FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Martinez Sr, Det. Harper, Det. Greene OPERATIONS Lt. Riley INFORMANT Adams, Lisa 75 Birch Road, Hilltown, Georgia 140-495. 92010. WINTON 13:55 Carjacking By 10:45 AM, Detectives Martinez, Harper, and Greene, together with Lieutenant Riley, worked to track the stolen vehicle's GPS. Captain G. L. Mitchell coordinated roadblocks. Sergeant E. H. Stone and Sergeant B. J. Duncan worked on gathering more witnesses from the nearby areas. By noon, Detective D. S. Greene confirmed the vehicle's location in a nearby town. FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION 3- STATUS [CHECK ONE] Det. Martinez Sr, Det. Harper, Det. Greene OPERATIONS Lt. Riley AFFIDAVIT - Carjacking Report 1) Cafe CCTV Footage 2) Witness Statements 3) F.I.R. 4) Vehicle Details 5) GPS Tracking Logs (6) Other Details LINE UP INFO ASSISTANT CHIEF DEPUTY IN CHARGE Q. Rodriguez H.P.D. 11.85 P32 1388 Warren, JAMES NAME: ADDRESS: TELEPHONE: 85-1670 DETECTIVE: A. MARTINEZ ITEM: 32-4500- 88 CRIME: 13:55 IDENTIFICATION NUMBER 81535 - CONFIRMED John Doe DATE 12/30/22 FORWARD TO: DETECTIVE DIVISION CONTINUED.
Identify each individual in the transcript, by name, who are directly referred to as officers, sergeants, lieutenants, captains, detectives, homicide officers, and crime lab personnel.

Officer Name: DET. A. B. Martinez  Officer Context: On June 8, DET. A. B. Martinez received an urgent call about a carjacking near Pine Street. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Lt. F. G. Riley  Officer Context: Lt. F. G. Riley - OPERATIONS Officer Role: Lieutenant Officer Name: Detective C. R. Harper  Officer Context: Detective C. R. Harper and Detective D. S. Greene joined the initial scene assessment. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective D. S. Greene  Officer Context: Detective C. R. Harper and Detective D. S. Greene joined the initial scene assessment. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Technician Mia  Officer Context: Tire. Technician Mia gathered tread marks from the scene. Officer Role: Technician (from the Crime Lab) Officer Name: Detective Martinez  Officer Context: By 10:45 AM, Detectives Martinez, Harper, and Greene, together with Lieutenant Riley, worked to track the stolen vehicle's GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Harper  Officer Context: By 10:45 AM, Detectives Martinez, Harper, and Greene, together with Lieutenant Riley, worked to track the stolen vehicle's GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Detective Greene  Officer Context: By 10:45 AM, Detectives Martinez, Harper, and Greene, together with Lieutenant Riley, worked to track the stolen vehicle's GPS. Officer Role: Detective Officer Name: Captain G. L. Mitchell  Officer Context: Captain G. L. Mitchell coordinated roadblocks. Officer Role: Captain Officer Name: Sergeant E. H. Stone  Officer Context: Sergeant E. H. Stone and Sergeant B. J. Duncan worked on gathering more witnesses from the nearby areas. Officer Role: Sergeant Officer Name: Sergeant B. J. Duncan Officer Context: Sergeant E. H. Stone and Sergeant B. J. Duncan worked on gathering more witnesses from the nearby areas. Officer Role: Sergeant
